all_questions.question: What is the purpose of vaccines?
all_questions.context: They pretend to be a dangerous infection.

all_questions.question: What is the basic principle of vaccinations?
all_questions.context: This is the basic principle of vaccinations.

all_questions.question: How many cases of measles were there in Europe in 2018?
all_questions.context: But there were only 83,000 cases of measles in Europe in 2018.

all_questions.question: What percentage of children who survive measles will have a severely damaged immune system?
all_questions.context: The children who survive will have a severely damaged immune system that takes a long time to recover.

all_questions.question: How many cases of pneumonia were there in the parallel universe where vaccinations were discontinued?
all_questions.context: 600,000 children, or 6%, get pneumonia, the most dangerous side effect of measles.

all_questions.question: How many children are expected to die from measles in a parallel universe where vaccinations were discontinued?
all_questions.context: Approximately 20,000 children will die from measles.

all_questions.question: What percentage of vaccinated children got a fever after vaccination?
all_questions.context: After they are vaccinated, about 10% of our 10,000,000 children get a fever.

all_questions.question: How many percent of vaccinated children got a slight rash after vaccination?
all_questions.context: 500,000, 5%, get a slight rash.

all_questions.question: What happens when 10,000,000 children are vaccinated with the MMR vaccine?
all_questions.context: After they are vaccinated, about 10% of our 10,000,000 children get a fever. 500,000, 5%, get a slight rash.

all_questions.question: What is the link between autism and vaccinations?
all_questions.context: The link between autism and vaccinations comes from a single source, which has since been refuted many times.

all_questions.question: How many people die from measles worldwide every year?
all_questions.context: In 2017, 110,000 people worldwide died from measles alone. Statistically, 300 children die from measles today.

all_questions.question: What is herd immunity?
all_questions.context: But to achieve this with measles, 95% of all people around you need to be vaccinated. The problem with the vaccination debate is that it is not being conducted fairly.

all_questions.question: How many children are expected to experience serious side effects from vaccinations?
all_questions.context: Up to 100 or 0.001% may have a serious allergic reaction that needs to be treated. Up to 10 boys, or 0.0001%, may develop genital inflammation.

all_questions.question: What is the relationship between vaccinations and seatbelts?
all_questions.context: You can compare vaccinations to seatbelts. Are there tragic accidents where someone is killed by their seatbelt? Yes, there are.

all_questions.question: What percentage of people around you need to be vaccinated to achieve herd immunity against measles?
all_questions.context: But to achieve this with measles, 95% of all people around you need to be vaccinated.

all_questions.question: How rare is it for a child to die from vaccinations?
all_questions.context: It is actually very difficult to say whether even a single one of our 10 million vaccinated children would die. We have done a lot of research on this and spoken to many experts.

all_questions.question: How rare are documented deaths from vaccinations compared to measles?
all_questions.context: Measles is many, many thousands of times more dangerous to our children than the absolute worst case of vaccine side effects.

all_questions.question: Can a child with an allergy ever get vaccinated?
all_questions.context: What if your child is actually allergic? What if our facts don't apply to your specific situation?

all_questions.question: Is the vaccination debate conducted fairly?
all_questions.context: The problem with the vaccination debate is that it is not being conducted fairly.

all_questions.question: What is herd immunity?
all_questions.context: Herd immunity means that so many people are immune to a disease that the pathogen cannot spread, but dies before it can reach its victims.

all_questions.question: Why do vaccinations need to be at such a high percentage for measles?
all_questions.context: But to achieve this with measles, 95% of all people around you need to be vaccinated.
